medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately two months prior to admission, the patient reduced his haloperidol dose due to running out of medication and began to experience increasing withdrawal and command auditory hallucinations from his delusional companion, Max. His symptoms worsened following difficulty renewing his driving license, leading to delusions of conspiracy among state bureaucrats to force him out of his job as a cab driver. On the day of admission, after attacking a security guard under Max's command, he was noted to be talking to himself and frantically pacing.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic paranoid schizophrenia diagnosed at age 23, history of strabismus repair at age 7. No history of manic or hypomanic episodes, severe head trauma, or seizure disorder.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with alcoholism, history of family instability after father left when the patient was 3 years old.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a 33-year-old Army veteran, employed as a cab driver, has daily marijuana use since age 11, and lives with his partner and two children. The family environment includes some awareness and accommodation to the patient's delusions regarding Max.
